title: Ticket #1716: condor_getcwd() foiled by getcwd() libc bug on solaris
description:
getcwd() has a bug under solaris as described here: getcwd() bug

This affects Condor because condor_getcwd() manually allocates memory trying to find a big enough buffer such that it can hold the path in question.

However, when getcwd() is called in a directory whose real path is > PATH_MAX, it will NEVER return anything other than NULL and ERANGE, even if the passed in buffer and size is plenty big enough to hold the path.

The fix should be in the if (errno == ERANGE) code block in condor_getcwd() function to check that if buflen is > 20 Megs, it is probably an error and the function should bail. I think we can survive with < 20 Meg paths for a good long time.... :)

This bug was found by our unit tests.
